metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: Matrices
A matrix is set of Numbers .
content.html: A matrix is set of Numbers.

content.text: A matrix is an Rectangular Array .
content.html: A matrix is an Rectangular Array.

content.text: A matrix is arranged in Rows and Columns .
content.html: A matrix is arranged in Rows and Columns.

content.text: Matrix Dimensions
This Matrix has 1 row and 3 columns:
content.html: This Matrix has 1 row and 3 columns:

content.text: The Dimension of the matrix is ( 1 x 3 ).
content.html: The Dimension of the matrix is (1x3).

content.text: This matrix has 2 rows and 3 columns:
content.html: This matrix has 2 rows and 3 columns:

content.text: The dimension of the matrix is ( 2 x 3 ).
content.html: The dimension of the matrix is (2x3).

content.text: Square Matrices
A Square Matrix is a matrix with the same number of rows and columns.
content.html: A Square Matrix is a matrix with the same number of rows and columns.

content.text: An n-by-n matrix is known as a square matrix of order n.
content.html: An n-by-n matrix is known as a square matrix of order n.

content.text: A 2-by-2 matrix (Square matrix of order 2):
content.html: A 2-by-2 matrix (Square matrix of order 2):

content.text: A 4-by-4 matrix (Square matrix of order 4):
content.html: A 4-by-4 matrix (Square matrix of order 4):

content.text: Diagonal Matrices
A Diagonal Matrix has values on the diagonal entries, and zero on the rest:
content.html: A Diagonal Matrix has values on the diagonal entries, and zero on the rest:

content.text: Scalar Matrices
A Scalar Matrix has equal diagonal entries and zero on the rest:
content.html: A Scalar Matrix has equal diagonal entries and zero on the rest:

content.text: The Identity Matrix
The Identity Matrix has 1 on the diagonal and 0 on the rest.
content.html: The Identity Matrix has 1 on the diagonal and 0 on the rest.

content.text: This is the matrix equivalent of 1. The symbol is I .
content.html: This is the matrix equivalent of 1. The symbol is I.

content.text: If you multiply any matrix with the identity matrix, the result equals the original.
content.html: If you multiply any matrix with the identity matrix, the result equals the original.

content.text: The Zero Matrix
The Zero Matrix (Null Matrix) has only zeros.
content.html: The Zero Matrix (Null Matrix) has only zeros.

content.text: Equal Matrices
Matrices are Equal if each element correspond:
content.html: Matrices are Equal if each element correspond:

content.text: Negative Matrices
The Negative of a matrix is easy to understand:
content.html: The Negative of a matrix is easy to understand:

content.text: Linear Algebra in JavaScript
In linear algebra, the most simple math object is the Scalar :
content.html: In linear algebra, the most simple math object is the Scalar:

content.code_html: const scalar = 1;

content.text: Another simple math object is the Array :
content.html: Another simple math object is the Array:

content.code_html: const array = [ 1, 2, 3 ];

content.text: Matrices are 2-dimensional Arrays :
content.html: Matrices are 2-dimensional Arrays:

content.code_html: const matrix = [ [1,2],[3,4],[5,6] ];

content.text: Vectors can be written as Matrices with only one column:
content.html: Vectors can be written as Matrices with only one column:

content.code_html: const vector = [ [1],[2],[3] ];

content.text: Vectors can also be written as Arrays :
content.html: Vectors can also be written as Arrays:

content.code_html: const vector = [ 1, 2, 3 ];

content.text: JavaScript Matrix Operations
Programming matrix operations in JavaScript, can easily become a spaghetti of loops.
content.html: Programming matrix operations in JavaScript, can easily become a spaghetti of loops.

content.text: Using a JavaScript library will save you a lot of headache.
content.html: Using a JavaScript library will save you a lot of headache.

content.text: One of the most common libraries to use for matrix operations is called math.js .
content.html: One of the most common libraries to use for matrix operations is called math.js.

content.text: It can be added to your web page with one line of code:
content.html: It can be added to your web page with one line of code:

content.code_html: <script src="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/mathjs/9.3.2/math.js"></script>

content.text: Adding Matrices
If two matrices have the same dimension, we can add them:
content.html: If two matrices have the same dimension, we can add them:

content.code_html:
const mA = math.matrix([[1, 2], [3, 4], [5, 6]]);
const mB = math.matrix([[1,-1], [2,-2], [3,-3]]);

// Matrix Addition
 const matrixAdd = math.add(mA, mB);

// Result [ [2, 1], [5, 2], [8, 3] ]

content.text: Subtracting Matrices
If two matrices have the same dimension, we can subtract them:
content.html: If two matrices have the same dimension, we can subtract them:

content.code_html:
const mA = math.matrix([[1, 2], [3, 4], [5, 6]]);
const mB = math.matrix([[1,-1], [2,-2], [3,-3]]);

// Matrix Subtraction
 const matrixSub = math.subtract(mA, mB);

// Result [ [0, 3], [1, 6], [2, 9] ]

content.text: To add or subtract matrices, they must have the same dimension.
content.html: To add or subtract matrices, they must have the same dimension.

content.text: Scalar Multiplication
While numbers in rows and columns are called Matrices , single numbers are called Scalars .
content.html: While numbers in rows and columns are called Matrices, single numbers are called Scalars.

content.text: It is easy to multiply a matrix with a scalar. Just multiply each number in the matrix with the scalar:
content.html: It is easy to multiply a matrix with a scalar. Just multiply each number in the matrix with the scalar:

content.code_html:
const mA = math.matrix([[1, 2], [3, 4], [5, 6]]);

// Matrix Multiplication
 const matrixMult = math.multiply(2, mA);

// Result [ [2, 4], [6, 8], [10, 12] ]

const mA = math.matrix([[0, 2], [4, 6], [8, 10]]);

// Matrix Division
 const matrixDiv = math.divide(mA, 2);

// Result [ [0, 1], [2, 3], [4, 5] ]

content.text: Transpose a Matrix
To transpose a matrix, means to replace rows with columns.
content.html: To transpose a matrix, means to replace rows with columns.

content.text: When you swap rows and columns, you rotate the matrix around it's diagonal.
content.html: When you swap rows and columns, you rotate the matrix around it's diagonal.

content.text: Multiplying Matrices
Multiplying matrices is more difficult.
content.html: Multiplying matrices is more difficult.

content.text: We can only multiply two matrices if the number of colums in matrix A is the same as the number of rows in matrix B.
content.html: We can only multiply two matrices if the number of colums in matrix A is the same as the number of rows in matrix B.

content.text: Then, we need to compile a "dot product":
content.html: Then, we need to compile a "dot product":

content.text: We need to multiply the numbers in each column of A with the numbers in each row of B , and then add the products:
content.html: We need to multiply the numbers in each column of A with the numbers in each row of B, and then add the products:

content.code_html:
const mA = math.matrix([1, 2, 3]);
const mB = math.matrix([[1, 4, 7], [2, 5, 8], [3, 6, 9]]);

// Matrix Multiplication
 const matrixMult = math.multiply(mA, mB);

// Result [14, 32, 50]

content.text: Explained:
If you know how to multiply matrices, you can solve many complex equations.
content.html: If you know how to multiply matrices, you can solve many complex equations.

content.text: Example
You sell roses.
content.html: You sell roses.

content.text: What was the value of all the sales?
content.html: What was the value of all the sales?

content.code_html:
const mA = math.matrix([3, 4, 2]);
const mB = math.matrix([[120, 90, 60], [80, 70, 40], [60, 40, 20]);

// Matrix Multiplication
 const matrixMult = math.multiply(mA, mB);

// Result [800, 630, 380]

content.text: Explained:
Matrix Factorization
With AI, you need to know how to factorize a matrix.
content.html: With AI, you need to know how to factorize a matrix.

content.text: Matrix factorization is a key tool in linear algebra, especially in Linear Least Squares.
content.html: Matrix factorization is a key tool in linear algebra, especially in Linear Least Squares.
